title: Flipped Learning-Based Training Course for Improving Information Literacy

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: A blended learning approach combining online pre-learning materials with offline activity-based classes, designed for students across disciplines (humanities, social sciences, sciences) to acquire core competencies in information evaluation

learning_goals: Learners can select reliable materials from academic databases according to a 3-step evaluation criteria (source, purpose, and recency).
Learners can analyze and present two or more cases of information bias in class discussions based on flipped learning materials.
Learners can evaluate the quality of academic papers by writing reports that utilize a checklist to verify the credibility of information sources.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
